item.title: Reboot Develop organiser issued bankruptcy order
item.content:encoded:
Chris Kerr,

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

February 26, 2026

2 Min Read

The future of boutique game development conference Reboot Develop has been cast into doubt after organizer Digitalna Avantura was hit with a bankruptcy order over roughly €520,000 in unpaid debts. 

As reported by Croatian outlet tportal (via Google Translate), financial agency Fina initiated proceedings against Digitalna Avantura in the Commercial Court of Zagreb after determining the company lacks the assets to cover a repayment. 

The court has now called on the creditors of Digitalna Avantura to advance €2,000 by the end of February to cover the costs of initiating bankruptcy. 

Digitalna Avantura is owned by Damira Đurovića, who is listed as a founder, director, and representative on the company's latest annual income statement (shared on the Fina website and viewed by tportal). 

Reboot Develop celebrated its 10th anniversary in 2025 in the Croatian city of Dubrovnik. The conference website (which remains live) said Reboot Develop aimed to increase its attendance to over 2,700 industry professionals from more than 850 companies last year. 

Related:EA makes layoffs at Skate developer Full Circle

There is no mention of a 2026 event on the event website. That's despite Reboot Develop advertising "super early bird" tickets on its LinkedIn page for a prospective 2026 conference around nine months ago. It's unclear whether those who accepted that offer will be issued refunds. 

At the time, Reboot Develop said the conference was hitting a "capacity ceiling" and implored attendees to secure their spot ahead of Reboot Develop 2026, which was slated to take place from April 20 to April 22, 2026. There has been no mention of the event since. 

Meanwhile, GamesIndustry.biz has been in contact with the Dubrovnik Sheraton—which has hosted the conference since 2015—and confirmed the hotel has not been booked to host a 2026 event. 

Game Developer has reached out to Reboot Develop for comment. 

About the Author

Senior Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Game Developer news editor Chris Kerr is an award-winning reporter with over a decade of experience in the game industry. His byline has appeared in notable print and digital publications including Edge, Stuff, Wireframe, International Business Times, and PocketGamer.biz. Throughout his career, Chris has covered major industry events including GDC, PAX Australia, Gamescom, Paris Games Week, and Develop Brighton.
